wikipedia_page.main: Sislin Fay Allen (20 March 1938 – 5 July 2021), known as Fay Allen, was a British and Jamaican police officer who was the first black woman police constable in the United Kingdom, serving in the Metropolitan Police in London from 1968 to 1972. She also worked for the Jamaica Constabulary Force.

response: * Fay Allen (1939–2021), British-Jamaican police officer, the first black woman police constable in the United Kingdom
